alert.note: Alert for St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 7:29PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR EASTERN LEE...SOUTHEASTERN ST. FRANCIS...SOUTHWESTERN CRITTENDEN...WESTERN DESOTO...NORTHERN TUNICA AND NORTHWESTERN TATE COUNTIES... At 728 PM CDT, a confirmed large and extremely dangerous tornado was located over North Tunica, or 15 miles northeast of St Francis National Park, moving east at 50 mph. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. At 727 PM CDT, tornado on the ground 4 miles northwest of Tunica. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. Locations impacted include... Hernando, Hughes, Coldwater, Walls, Tunica, Horseshoe Lake, Pinckney, Lake Cormorant, Phillipp, Eudora, North Tunica, Arkabutla, Robinsonville, Newport, Clack, Trinity, Frees Corners, Commerce, Austin and Peters. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
